page.title: 18LEISURE IN THE AREA
page.content: {Entertainment}is an important part of life and will prove even more important in the future if current unemployment trends continue. Clubs and societies may no longer be regarded as after work activities, but may become a normal part of daily life. A selection of the local clubs and voluntary societies are represented on the Warrington Community Council, which is a part of the decision-making process of the Borough Council. Included are representatives of the churches, the Borough Council, and many voluntary bodies, such as: Warrington Boy's Club, Disabled Driver's Association, Gingerbread, Girl Guides, Jamait ul Muslemeen, Lions International, Rotary Club, Round Table, Royal Antediluvian Order of Buffaloes, Scout Council and more.
